required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Myofascial Release on Muscle Mechanical Properties
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Different Variation of Myofascial Release Application Speed on Muscle Mechanical Properties

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates effect of self-myofascial release in different paces on muscle biomechanics. All participants will use foam roller in different paces once in a week with weeks apart.

detailed_description.textblock: Foam-roller is a widely used self-myofascial release method in sports. Although, effects of foam-roller has been shown, there is no defined speed of usage. Using foam-roller in different paces could cause different changes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will use a foam roller at three different paces in a randomized sequence with a week between,

primary_outcome.description: Myotonometer-3 will be used for measuring viscoelastic properties (tone, elasticity, stiffness)

secondary_outcome.description: Modified Thomas test would be used for measuring hip flexors tightness

arm_group.description: Participants will use foam roller in following order of 30RPM(I), 15RPM(II) and self-determined(III)
Participants will use foam roller in following order of 30RPM(I), self-determined(III) and 15RPM(II)
Participants will use foam roller in following order of 15RPM(II), 30RPM(I) and self-determined(III)
Participants will use foam roller in following order of 15RPM(II), self-determined(III) and 30RPM(I)
Participants will use foam roller in following order of self-determined(III), 30RPM(I) and 15RPM(II)
Participants will use foam roller in following order of self-determined(III), 15RPM(II) and 30RPM(I)

intervention.description: Participants will start using foam roller from muscle origin to insertion with a speed of 2 secs. Then comeback from insertion to origin with 2 secs. With total of 15 repeats x 2 sets per leg. With 30 seconds rest between.

Participants will start using foam roller from muscle origin to insertion with a speed of 4 secs. Then comeback from insertion to origin with 4 secs. With total of 15 repeats x 2 sets per leg. With 30 seconds rest between.

Participants will start using foam roller from muscle origin to insertion with self determined-speed. Then comeback from insertion to origin with same pace. With total of 15 repeats x 2 sets per leg. With 30 seconds rest between.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being a professional athlete with at least 2 years of sport history
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having a chronic-systemic disease
- Having a lower extremity injury

reference.citation: Curran PF, Fiore RD, Crisco JJ. A comparison of the pressure exerted on soft tissue by 2 myofascial rollers. J Sport Rehabil. 2008 Nov;17(4):432-42.
Kumka M, Bonar J. Fascia: a morphological description and classification system based on a literature review. J Can Chiropr Assoc. 2012 Sep;56(3):179-91.
